body:
I just tested v1.4.1 under 
Linux Mint 17 

``` console
Linux ThinkFastPad 3.13.0-24-generic #47-Ubuntu SMP Fri May 2 23:30:00 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

with
openjdk

``` bash
JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64"
```

And everything works fine.

The PC is a Lenovo ThinkPad X201

The only UI related changes since 1.3.1 were tool tips, I don't see how those would create your rendering issues.  

What have you changed since last downloading?

First, I forgot to specify what I'm using, which I should've before:

```
$ java -version
java version "1.6.0_32"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.13.4) (6b32-1.13.4-1~deb7u1)
OpenJDK Server VM (build 23.25-b01, mixed mode)
```

Then I'm running Debian GNU/Linux 8 (Jessie), 32-bit i686, Dell Latitude D830.
`Linux nevermind 3.16-2-686-pae #1 SMP Debian 3.16.3-2 (2014-09-20) i686 GNU/Linux`

Also, as for Tom-Ski's question, I recompiled the old source-code for 1.3.1, and it turns out that 1.3.1 also has the same problem. This could be due to my recent upgrade to Debian 8 from Debian 7, or that I simply upgraded something that broke it (in Debian Testing there are always new updates going around, and it's hard to keep track of them all).

I'll have to play around a bit to see what the problem could be. But it doesn't seem too directly related to the gdx-setup.jar right now.
OK, we'll close this and if it turns out the problem is actually related to gdx-setup then we can reopen it.

I experience the same problem after upgrading to Fedora 21. Neither JDK8 nor JDK7 nor openJDK does solve the problem. I guess it could be some sort of dependencie problem.  On Fedora 20 everything was fine.
Well, at least there's a commandline version.

Please  reopen this PR.

I'm seeing this on Fedora 21, as well. Brand new install, running NVIDIA driver version 343.36 on an x86_64 system. Oracle Java 8u25. 

I find that I can "paint" some of the controls by slowly hovering my pointer over the dialog. I assume because the buttons get repainted on mouse enter. This is further supported by the fact that, if browse and select a destination, the destination text box is then painted. Likewise, if I click where any text box is located, I can "paint" it by selecting the characters.

I'll try it tonight on my laptop, which is also x86_64 Fedora 21, but with the Intel integrated GPU.

For those of us having these issues, what Java are we running (Oracle, OpenJDK)? Then, what version are we running?

In my case I'm running OpenJDK 1.6.0_32

```
$ java -version
java version "1.6.0_32"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.13.4) (6b32-1.13.4-1~deb7u1)
OpenJDK Server VM (build 23.25-b01, mixed mode)
```

I'm not quite sure what we can do about this. The setup app is just a Swing
app. Do other Swing apps work as expected?
On Jan 16, 2015 5:45 PM, "Nicolás A. Ortega" notifications@github.com
wrote:

> For those of us having these issues, what Java are we running (Oracle,
> OpenJDK)? Then, what version are we running?

> java version "1.6.0_32"
> OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.13.4) (6b32-1.13.4-1~deb7u1)
> OpenJDK Server VM (build 23.25-b01, mixed mode)
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2475#issuecomment-70282378.

I have the issue with openjdk, Oracle JFK 7 and 8.
Seems jdk independe

Am Freitag, 16. Januar 2015 schrieb Mario Zechner :

> I'm not quite sure what we can do about this. The setup app is just a
> Swing
> app. Do other Swing apps work as expected?

> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2475#issuecomment-70286273.

OK, now I've reproduced the issue on my laptop, so it's not GPU driver specific.

Fedora 21 again, Intel integrated GPU, Oracle Java 8u25.

Other Swing apps run fine -- I tried IDEA 14.1, NetBeans 8, the GUI I develop for my day job, and Vuze. All are Swing apps, all display correctly. I run all with light themes normally, but I also tried IDEA with Darcula, and that still displays fine. 

So far, it's just gdxsetup.jar that's busted.

It's something to do with the fact that the setup UI is an undecorated dialog.

If I change the code in GdxSetupUI to not setUndecorated(true), then everything displays clearly. One alternative would be to remove the fancy schmancy self drawn "title bar" and use the OS title bar. If I can't figure out why the heck the dialog isn't painting properly when undecorated (or if no one else does) soon, I'm going to put that patch together in my fork, so I can at least use the setup tool for now.

Right now, though, I need to go AFK to take my wife out to dinner for her birthday. Priorities, you know! ;P
If you could give forcing a repaint after the JFrame has been set to visible, maybe revalidate also.

I've submitted a pull request for a simple fix to this issue: if the JFrame is pack()ed before setting visible, it is no longer blank. I notice a few other paint issues (e.g., some labels and controls paint the wrong color until moused over), but those are likely separate issues, and they don't affect functionality. I'll try to look into those issues in the next couple days, time permitting.
@Sindisil Thanks for the PR, fixed it up so the log displayed correctly.  If you could give the other changes a test too that would be great.
I've just pulled and compiled the libgdx source code and it seems to be working.
I concur with Deathsbreed - looks good to me now. Sorry for the half baked PR last night - I should have waited until I had time to test more fully. Thanks for completing the fix, Tom-Ski!
